member.name: T:Tools.RuntimeT.CompilerServicesT.MakePublicAttribute
member.summary: When applied on a type or a member indicates that postprocessing tool should change visibility of the member to public
member.remarks: Applying this attribute on a type or a member causes nothing on itself. You must run supporting post-processsing tool (such as AssemblyPostprocessoer) on your assembly once it's compiled to apply changes denoted by this attributes.
member.version: This class is new in version 1.5.4

member.name: M:Tools.RuntimeT.CompilerServicesT.MakeTypePublicAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: CTor - creates a new instance of the class
member.param: Full name of type to be made public. Do not include any specifiers that are not part of type

member.name: P:Tools.RuntimeT.CompilerServicesT.MakeTypePublicAttribute.TypeName
member.summary: Gets name of type (in current module) to be made public

member.name: M:Tools.RuntimeT.CompilerServicesT.RemoveAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: CTor - creates a new instance of the class
member.remarks: Instance created using default constructor does not indicate removal of dependent items

member.name: M:Tools.RuntimeT.CompilerServicesT.RemoveAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: CTor - creates a new instance of the class indicating if dependent metadata should be deleted as well
member.param: True to remove related metadata as well, false to keep them

member.name: P:Tools.RuntimeT.CompilerServicesT.RemoveAttribute.RemoveRelatedMetadata
member.summary: Gets value indicating if related metadata are removed or not
member.remarks:
When true current implementation is:
When method is removed from type and it is used as property/event accessor on the same type the accessoer is removed. If after this removal the property has neither setter nor getter the property is removed. If it is an event and it has neither adder nor remover its removed, too.
When property or event is removed accessor methods are removed as well (as long as theyy were declared in the same type and were marked as specialname).

member.name: T:Tools.RuntimeT.CompilerServicesT.RemoveAttribute
member.summary: When applied on an item indicates that postprocessing tool should remove the item from it's parent
member.remarks: Applying this attribute on a member causes nothing on itself. You must run supporting post-processsing tool (such as AssemblyPostprocessoer) on your assembly once it's compiled to apply changes denoted by this attributes.
member.version: This class is new in version 1.5.4

member.name: T:Tools.RuntimeT.CompilerServicesT.RenameAttribute
member.summary: When applied on a type or a member indicates that postprocessing tool should rename the member
member.remarks: Applying this attribute on a type or a member causes nothing on itself. You must run supporting post-processsing tool (such as AssemblyPostprocessoer) on your assembly once it's compiled to apply changes denoted by this attributes.
member.version: This class is new in version 1.5.4

member.name: M:Tools.RuntimeT.CompilerServicesT.AddResourceAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: CTor - creates a new instance of the class
member.param: File that contains resource data. For embedded resource data are red from that file and embedded to assembly (so absolute path may be acceptable), for linked resources this file name is recorded to a module.
True to create embedded resource (data are stored in assembly), false to create linked resource (requires additional file to be distributed with assembly).
True to create private resource, false to create public resource.

member.summary: Gets path to file that contains resource data

member.name: P:Tools.RuntimeT.CompilerServicesT.AddResourceAttribute.Private

member.name: T:Tools.RuntimeT.CompilerServicesT.AddResourceAttribute
member.summary: When applied on an assembly or a module indicates tha postrpocessing tool should add resource to the assembly or module
member.remarks:
Applying this attribute on a member causes nothing on itself. You must run supporting post-processsing tool (such as AssemblyPostprocessoer) on your assembly once it's compiled to apply changes denoted by this attributes.
When applied on an assembly resources are added to main module of the assembly.
member.version: This class is new in version 1.5.4

member.name: P:Tools.RuntimeT.CompilerServicesT.ImplementsAttribute.Member
member.summary: Gets name of member to override / implement

member.name: T:Tools.RuntimeT.CompilerServicesT.ImplementsAttribute
member.summary: When applied on a method, property or event indicates that postprocessing tool should indicate that the member overrides base class member or implements interface member
member.remarks: Applying this attribute on a member causes nothing on itself. You must run supporting post-processsing tool (such as AssemblyPostprocessoer) on your assembly once it's compiled to apply changes denoted by this attributes.

member.name: M:Tools.RuntimeT.CompilerServicesT.PostprocessorAttribute.#ctor(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: CTor - creates a new instance of the from type and method name
member.param: Type method to postprocess this attribute is defined in

Name of postprocessing method. The method must be member of type , it must be public, static and it must have 2 or 3 parameters. 1st one must be of type . 2nd one should accept the type this attribute as applied on. 3rd (if present) must be asssignable from . If these conditions are not satisfied postprocessing will fail.

member.name: M:Tools.RuntimeT.CompilerServicesT.PostprocessorAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: CTor - creates a new instance of the from type name and method name
member.param: Name of type method to postprocess this attribute is defined in. You should use name of type in format suitable for and .

Name of postprocessing method. The method must be member of type , it must be public, static and it must have 2 or 3 parameters. 1st one must be of type . 2nd one should accept the type this attribute as applied on. 3rd (if present) must be asssignable from . If these conditions are not satisfied postprocessing will fail.

member.name: P:Tools.RuntimeT.CompilerServicesT.PostprocessorAttribute.Method
member.summary: Gets name of postprocessing method

member.name: P:Tools.RuntimeT.CompilerServicesT.PostprocessorAttribute.Type
member.summary: Gets type postprocessing method is defined in
member.returns: If was passed to the constructor returns that type. Otherwise returns type obtained using from (which may return nulll if the type cannot be found).

member.name: P:Tools.RuntimeT.CompilerServicesT.PostprocessorAttribute.TypeName
member.summary: Gets name of type postpúrocessing method is defined in
member.returns: If type name was passed to a constructor returns that name. Otherwise returns .AssemblyQualifiedName

member.name: M:Tools.RuntimeT.CompilerServicesT.PostprocessorAttribute.GetMethod
member.summary: Gets a method to be used for postprocessing
member.returns: A method of type with name , which is public and static and has 2 or 3 arguments. 1st argument must be . 2nd one is not checked. 3rd (if present) must be asssignable from . Returns null if is null or if such method cannot be found.
member.exception: More than one suitable methods found.

member.name: T:Tools.RuntimeT.CompilerServicesT.PostprocessorAttribute
member.summary: Apply this attribute on -derived class to indicate how to perform post-processing the attribute class defines. You tipically do not use this attrubute unless you are defining your own post-processor.
member.remarks: It's recomended that your post-processing class derives from .
member.version: This class is new in version 1.5.4
